view.name: Health and Care Information Models (HCIM) 2017 Index

concept.name: AllergyIntolerance
concept.desc: Root concept of the AllergyIntolerance information model. This root concept contains all data elements of the AllergyIntolerance information model.

community.name: ICA612_2_MedMij112All
community.data: Bij allergie/intolerantie kunnen alleen overgevoeligheden die aanwezig zijn worden gemapt. De overige condities (met code 'DX') kunnen niet worden gemapt op AllergieIntolerantie. In 6.12 zijn er alleen overgevoeligheden voor medicatie, overige overgevoeligheden zijn geen onderdeel van de 6.12 informatiestandaard. In 6.12 is het niet toegestaan om condities te ontkennen, als dit t√≥ch gebeurt worden deze condities niet gemapt.

concept.name: Basic Components HCIMRoot
concept.desc: Rootconcept of the information model in question

concept.name: IdentificationNumber
concept.desc: Globally unique number that identifies the instantiation of the information model. The number is composed of an identification of the issuer organization and a unique number assigned by this organization

concept.name: InformationSource
concept.desc:
The person who provided the information and ensures the correctness of it.
This is not always a healthprofessional, but it may also be the patient or another person, such as a parent, caretaker or guardian.
The source of information does not have to be the author of the information, who in that case is only instrumental in capturing the information.

community.name: ICA612_2_MedMij112All
community.data: ZIB BasisElementen heeft nu exact 1 informant. FHIR kent 0..1 informant. De 6.12 condition kan er echter 0..* bevatten. Aangemeld bij het bestaande [https://bits.nictiz.nl/browse/ZIB-737 ZIB issue 737]

concept.name: PatientAsInformationSource
concept.desc: The patient as source of the information

concept.name: Patient
concept.desc: Root concept of the Patient information model. This root concept contains all data elements of the Patient information model.

concept.name: HealthProfessional
concept.desc: The health professional as source of the information

community.name: ICA612_2_MedMij112All
community.data: deze groep is van toepassing voor iedere informant/assignedPerson

concept.name: HealthProfessional
concept.desc:
Root concept of the HealthProfessional information model. This root concept contains all data elements of the HealthProfessional information model.
When referring to this information model the role the health professional fulfils in the healthcare process can be addressed additionally. For health professionals, this could be for example main practitioner or referrer.

concept.name: RelatedPersonAsInformationSource
concept.desc: The related person (parent, caregiver, ...) as source of the information

community.name: ICA612_2_MedMij112All
community.data: deze groep is van toepassing voor iedere informant/responsibleParty

concept.name: Contact
concept.desc: Root concept of the Contact information model. This root concept contains all data elements of the Contact information model.

concept.name: Author
concept.desc: The person who has recorded the information. Depending on the information system in which the data is recorded, this may be the patient, healthcare provider or other person.

concept.name: PatientAsAuthor
concept.desc: The patient as author of the information

concept.name: Patient
concept.desc: Root concept of the Patient information model. This root concept contains all data elements of the Patient information model.

concept.name: HealthProfessional
concept.desc:
Root concept of the HealthProfessional information model. This root concept contains all data elements of the HealthProfessional information model.
When referring to this information model the role the health professional fulfils in the healthcare process can be addressed additionally. For health professionals, this could be for example main practitioner or referrer.

concept.name: RelatedPersonAsAuthor
concept.desc: The related person (parent, caregiver, ...) as author of the information

concept.name: Contact
concept.desc: Root concept of the Contact information model. This root concept contains all data elements of the Contact information model.

concept.name: Subject
concept.desc: The person to whom the information relates. Often this will be the patient, but especially in the case of small children as patients it may be information about the parent or caregiver. Especially in the nurse transfers, for example, Competence and involvement of caregivers carries a role.

concept.name: Patient
concept.desc: The patient as subject of the information

concept.name: Patient
concept.desc: Root concept of the Patient information model. This root concept contains all data elements of the Patient information model.

concept.name: RelatedPersonAsSubject
concept.desc: The related person (parent, caregiver, ...) as subject of the information

concept.name: Contact
concept.desc: Root concept of the Contact information model. This root concept contains all data elements of the Contact information model.

concept.name: DateTime
concept.desc:
Date and if relevant the time the event to which the information relates took place .
This is the medically relevant date and time.

concept.name: CausativeAgent
concept.desc: Substance, group of substances or environmental factor to which the patient is allergic or hypersensitive.

community.name: ICA612_2_MedMij112All
community.data: In 6.12 is dit √©√©n van de volgende * Stofnaamcode (SNK) OID 2.16.840.1.113883.2.4.4.1.750 * Stofnaamcode i.c.m. toedieningsweg (SSK) OID 2.16.840.1.113883.2.4.4.1.725 * Ongewenste groep OID 2.16.840.1.113883.2.4.4.1.902.122 * Handelsproduct (HPK) 2.16.840.1.113883.2.4.4.7

concept.name: AllergyCategory
concept.desc: Identifies the allergy category such as medication, food or environment.

community.name: ICA612_2_MedMij112All
community.data: Alleen gebruiken als er een causativeAgent bestaat. Vaste waarde: Medicijn (Propensity to adverse reactions to drug, 419511003, SNOMED CT)

concept.displayName: Propensity to adverse reactions to food
concept.name: Propensity to adverse reactions to food

concept.displayName: Propensity to adverse reactions to drug
concept.name: Propensity to adverse reactions to drug
AllergyStatus
concept.desc: Statement on the status of the patient‚Äôs hypersensitivity.

concept.name: StartDateTime
concept.desc:
The date and time at which the allergy or undesired reaction was determined.
This can be an exact date and time, or a rough indication of the date (such as only the year, or the month and the year).

concept.name: Criticality
concept.desc:
Critical extent is defined as ‚Äúthe potential severity of future reactions.‚Äù
This represents a clinical evaluation of the worst case scenario for a future reaction. It can be based on the severity of past reactions, the dose and manner of exposure which caused reactions in the past, and the life-threatening potential of the type of reaction. Critical extent is a property of the allergy, and not of the reaction itself.

community.name: ICA612_2_MedMij112All
community.data: Ernst van de observatie mag niet gebruikt worden in 6.12

valueSet.name: MateVanKritiekZijnCodelijst

concept.name: LastReactionDateTime
concept.desc: Entry of the last time a hypersensitive reaction took place.

concept.name: Comment
concept.desc: Textual explanation of the hypersensitivity which cannot be entered in any of the other fields.

community.name: ICA612_2_MedMij112All
community.data: 6.12 heeft bij de comment ook verplicht een auteur, waarin een tijdstip en zorgverlener/id kan worden vastgelegd.

terminologyAssociation.codeSystemName: Logical Observation Identifier Names and Codes

concept.name: Reaction
concept.desc: Container of the Reaction concept. This container contains all data elements of the Reaction concept.

concept.name: Symptom
concept.desc: The content specifications of the reaction that takes place when the patient is exposed to the causative substance.

valueSet.name: SymptoomCodelijst
valueSet.copyright: This artefact includes content from SNOMED Clinical Terms¬Æ (SNOMED CT¬Æ) which is copyright of the International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO). Implementers of these artefacts must have the appropriate SNOMED CT Affiliate license - for more information contact http://www.snomed.org/snomed-ct/getsnomed-ct or info@snomed.org.

concept.name: SpecificSubstance
concept.desc: More specific indication of the substance that caused the reaction. This can be a specific substance from a group of substances to which the patient is allergic or hypersensitive.

concept.name: ReactionDescription
concept.desc: Textual description of the reaction as a whole.

concept.name: Severity
concept.desc: The severity of the reaction as a result of exposure to the causative substance.

valueSet.name: ErnstCodelijst

concept.name: RouteOfExposure
concept.desc: Way in which the patient came into contact with the causative agent or the way in which the agent was administered.

Implementers of these artefacts must have the appropriate SNOMED CT Affiliate license - for more information contact http://www.snomed.org/snomed-ct/getsnomed-ct or info@snomed.org.

concept.name: ReactionTime
concept.desc: Date and time at which the reaction took place. This may also be just the date or a partial date, in the event that the exact date is unknown.
